name: Amiga 8-Bit Sound File
summary: Learn about .8SVX files and view a list of programs that open them.

content:
Many programs are associated with these files on Windows and Mac OS. Many programs can be used to tackle these files. It is an encoded audio format for Commodore Amiga. The features like attack, section repeat, and release are supported by these files. These features are used to store samples of musical instruments. The lossy data compression of Fibonacci-delta is available that results in the compression ratio of 50% and decrease the fidelity.

Since Amiga computer systems are rarely used anymore, 8SVX files are primarily used for preserving and listening to old music.
NOTE: 8SVX files are sometimes seen with the ".iff" extension.

description: Developed by Electronic Arts, the 8SVX file format is a digital audio standard specifically for Amiga computers, functioning as a dedicated data subtype of the broader IFF container format. It stores 8-bit audio samples within distinct data chunks, while separate descriptor chunks contain all the crucial metadata about the audio stream. While Amiga computer systems are now rarely in active use, the primary modern application of 8SVX files is the preservation and playback of classic video game music and retro audio samples from that era.
Audio file used by the older Amiga personal computers; stores recorded audio in the 8-bit quality 8SVX format, which is a derivative format of the .IFF specification; supports mono and stereo sound.
